title: VIDEO: From relay run to Cresta Run for Mark Lewis-Francis
text:
Tweet 
The Smethwick-born sprinter, who was part of the 4x100m relay team that stunningly claimed gold in the 2004 Athens Olympics, has been training at the bobsleigh headquarters at Bath University and holds high hopes on ice. 
The next Winter Olympics, to be held in 2018 in South Korea, are a realistic aim, said Lewis-Francis. Mark Lewis-Francis pelting it down the track. Looks fairly terrifying @ExpressandStar #DarlastonDart pic.twitter.com/FKYyevhCcw — Lewis Cox. (@LewisCox_star) October 5, 2015 
He said: “I wouldn’t be the first to compete at both but if I make the Olympic team and we win a medal then I’ll be first British athlete to achieve a summer and a winter medal. 
“So for me that’s definitely on the cards. It’s a goal and a possible achievement. If I can help these guys get down the slope in one piece and in a quick time then I’m all for it.” 
The 33-year-old, who trains twice a week in Bath, is still a member of Birchfield Harriers and trains regularly at The Alexandra Stadium where he refuses to let go of a dream return to the summer Olympic sprinting squad. “Moving forward onto 2016 and I’m in a good place. I’ve got the support of physios who will keep me injury-free. I’ve got a speed team that I can work with,” he added. What do you think? Log in and start commenting 
“Hopefully it should all work out. We’ll wait and see how it goes. But they should compliment each other and blend brilliantly. The power and speed in the bobsleigh will help me massively. 
“We’ve got back from Switzerland where we were training last week and it was my first ever two-man push. You just don’t realise how fast that thing moves – it’s a good job my legs can still move to jump in there! 
After suffering niggling injuries over the last couple of seasons, the Birchfield Harrier revealed the change in scenery is like a breath of fresh air. More on this story:
